body:
@felixcheung Thanks for your reviewing.

> to be explicitly, let's add manually -> manually by an user opening this notebook

I fixed it. (I used a correct phrase of `a user`.)

Thanks.
![default](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25951039/33764614-398f78b4-dc26-11e7-9bc5-c894af521c18.PNG)
Ah yes ;)
@bushnoh thanks for the contribution, could you check the CI, some tests fails.
@zjffdu The CI errors look unrelated. They're for the IPythonInterpreter and are the same ones that are failing on master.
Hi guys no news?
You'd better rebase from current master to make your branch newer.
@Leemoonsoo Thanks. I have added a test case as you mentioned. Please have a look.

Whether a user can find the notebook in trash or not is based on permission of the notebook, then If user 'B' has properly permission for the notebook deleted by user 'A', user 'B' can find the notebook in trash.

However, I find some issues in this PR. 
For example, user 'A' delete a notebook, then user 'B' restore the notebook from trash. In this PR, even if user 'B' has 'owner' permission for the notebook, cannot do that now.
Sorry for late response @tinkoff-dwh , LGTM, will merge it if no more comments
Merge to master if no further comment
Thanks @conker84. LGTM and merge to master if no further comment.

Tested this branch.

![zeppelin_notename](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1540981/33910594-283a3dda-df44-11e7-806f-4965a638745b.gif)

It shows only note name, but when i try to edit, it shows full path. Things little bit inconsistent to me although i don't have any good idea to improve.
@tinkoff-dwh @felixcheung what do you guys think?

Tested manually. Thanks @tinkoff-dwh for the improvement.
LGTM and merge to master if no further discussions.

Thanks @namanmishra91. Looks great to me!
Merge to master if no further comment.
@Leemoonsoo @jongyoul @felixcheung @prabhjyotsingh any more comments ? I will merge it if no more comments
@bushnoh I have fixed the CI failure, could you rebase this PR and retrigger the travis build ?
Any more comments ? I will merge if no more comments.

@Leemoonsoo 
What about this option?

![capture5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25951039/33941542-1377ccce-e024-11e7-8a33-57e729e31c14.PNG)
Now note name clipped on the left.

@zjffdu I have merged in the changed from master however there are still CI failures. They are again both unrelated and are the ones that are happening on master: https://travis-ci.org/apache/zeppelin/builds/315822086
@bushnoh https://travis-ci.org/apache/zeppelin/builds/315822086 This build doesn't include your PR, and some flaky test is known issue of zeppelin, but IPython related failure should be fixed.

Travis CI turned to green by merging https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/2703 to my branch: https://travis-ci.org/kjmrknsn/zeppelin/builds/315898589

I would be glad if this PR would be merged.
Ready to review
Ready to review
Ready to review
Added documentation, CI failure looks unrelated.
Thanks @jithinchandranj. Could you add test case for new functionality?
@felixcheung ping :)
Can you restart some failed job on https://travis-ci.org/mohamagdy/zeppelin/builds/317797015?

Hi @tinkoff-dwh ,
Attached test case for the custom realm functionality.
@prabhjyotsingh Could you help review it ? Thanks
@1ambda Can you review it? It's kind of your idea :-)

I was tested. Looks good :)
Lgtm
Thanks @kjmrknsn. Merge to master if no further review!

@tinkoff-dwh Looks good to me!

Merge to master if no further comment.
@zjffdu I was trying to show that the tests failing in master (that don't include my changes) are the same ones with the same errors that are failing on my branch with the changes
closing this- lol at "hotfix"
Thanks @weand mostly LGTM, just a minor issue

This is generated by npm v5 and it would not be changed until we change
dependencies. If it doesn't exist, npm creates it again when it runs
scripts. So adding it helps to reduce whole build time.

Will try this for both spark and shell interpreter, and post my finding later today.
@weand CI still fails, very probably it is flaky test, but could you retrigger the CI ? I'd like to make sure these failed test is not caused by this PR before merging.
check jobs in Jenkins. try to merge the latest changes from master.

@felixcheung 
I fixed it
@felixcheung Yes, yarn is faster than npm4 but recently, npm5 is much faster than yarn. FE moves so fast :-)

how can I retrigger CI? 

EDIT: simply amended the last commit slightly changing the commit msg.

Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 3, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 164.418 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.zeppelin.integration.InterpreterModeActionsIT

seems to be a flaky test, see log [here](https://travis-ci.org/weand/zeppelin/jobs/318812306)
LGTM
Thanks. Will merge it
hi guys, any news?
Thank @tinkoff-dwh , latest commits are merged to the branch, and the PR is updated.
you can close and reopen this PR to trigger CI
sorry - will check within the next day
LGTM
LGTM

From a UX usability point of view it seems better to disable a control instead of hiding it.

Would love others thought on that as well.
@zjffdu can u confirm it's a flaky test?
What's the result of your rerun ? I don't see this test fails frequently in other PRs.
Thanks for the review will merge this if no more discussion.
Thanks for the review will merge this if no more discussion.

@felixcheung 
What do you say about this?

## Enable
![enable](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25951039/34248202-3458b250-e646-11e7-9f3b-b5bac755f1c4.png)


## Disable
![disable](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25951039/34248143-fafb894c-e645-11e7-81dc-e7af28322896.png)

@Leemoonsoo 
merge?

close and reopen PR does NOT trigger the CI.

now merged latest master again, and awaiting test results.

This time it failed here:
org.apache.zeppelin.integration.InterpreterModeActionsIT.testPerUserIsolatedAction(InterpreterModeActionsIT.java:729)

the last time it failed at another line - 660:
org.apache.zeppelin.integration.InterpreterModeActionsIT.testPerUserIsolatedAction(InterpreterModeActionsIT.java:660)

this seems quite flaky. Can not see, why the changes here break this test. Do you have any idea?

If you see this failed test consistently, I would suspect it may due to this PR. Because I didn't see this failed test consistently in other PRs.  You can follow the instruction here to run selenium test in local machine.

https://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.8.0-SNAPSHOT/development/contribution/how_to_contribute_code.html#run-selenium-test
Thanks @prabhjyotsingh comments has been addressed. And CI passed
Rest, looks good.
Thanks, Merge if no more comment

@Manituti 
What is it?

Don't get the Selenium tests running properly.

Instead of the error from Travis CI, I face other errors, that number of python processes is wrong.

```
21:05:52,088  INFO org.apache.zeppelin.CommandExecutor:46 - Sending command "bash -c ps aux | grep 'zeppelin_ipython' | grep -v 'grep' | wc -l" to localhost
21:05:52,290  INFO org.apache.zeppelin.CommandExecutor:46 - Sending command "bash -c ps aux | grep 'zeppelin/interpreter/python/*' | sed -E '/grep|local-repo/d' | wc -l" to localhost
21:05:56,226  INFO org.apache.zeppelin.CommandExecutor:46 - Sending command "bash -c ../bin/zeppelin-daemon.sh restart" to localhost
Tests run: 11, Failures: 11, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 471.138 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.zeppelin.integration.InterpreterModeActionsIT
testPerUserIsolatedAction(org.apache.zeppelin.integration.InterpreterModeActionsIT)  Time elapsed: 186.266 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: The number of python process is
Expected: "1"
     but: was "0"
	at org.hamcrest
```

I already have ipython + jupyter installed. Also Firefox 31 with Auto Update disabled.

When starting zeppelin and a python notebook (created by the tests) manually, I get proper results inside Web GUI. I also see various zeppelin processes via ps aux. But the grep pipes used in the test doesn't cover them.

Could anyone please assist, who can run the test properly. @soralee ?
merged, thanks
shouldn't this PR say "config storage" instead of "storage layer"?
@Manituti hi - please close this - if you have a question please contact user@zeppelin.apache.org
and we should probably check why RAT doesn't pick up the missing ASF header for new files?

yes, I think
someone else should also review this though
make sense, PR and jira title changed
need reworking
@1ambda   hi, is there any conclusion?
Ready to review

@Leemoonsoo @felixcheung 

there are no the comments a long time, need to merge
merged
@tinkoff-dwh I think this has the wrong JIRA number...

@zjffdu 
i think it is not user friendly interface (popups from backend)
@tinkoff-dwh I am not saying popup from backend. I mean backend send error message to frontend, and frontend pop up this error message.

@jongyoul I fixed the Appveyor test, but having problems with the Jenkins Python tests.

I don't believe these are related to my changes.. can you suggest what I can try next?
I seperated issue of pid and log because log has some issue.
what's the next step then?

Hi, Thanks for the contribution. I, however, couldn't access your travis CI. Zeppelin uses your CI to test your PR, thus you need to enable it. Please check the document below and set it up.

http://zeppelin.apache.org/contribution/contributions.html#continuous-integration
Concerning your PR, LGTM
@jongyoul Ok, I rerequested. #2716

Hi, I checked your CI but it got a maven error. can you restart your CI? I'll leave your CI link to check it easily.

https://travis-ci.org/woowahan-jaehoon/zeppelin/branches
You can re-trigger jenkins by closing and opening this PR. You don't have to make a new PR for triggering it.

@jongyoul Thank you for checking it. I know that but repository of #2715 is privated so I re-requested.

And I'm checking about fail.
Travis CI issue is tracked in ZEPPELIN-3118

@matyix Could you rebase it ? And it might be a little slow for the community to review this PR, as it is a large PR and k8s is new to the community, but we welcome any new cutting technology like this.

Hello @zjffdu - I rebased and pushed upstream, please have a look. Thanks for your comment, I look forward supporting you to get this PR merged upstream (now that the Spark on Kubernetres fork got merged this is more actual than ever).
